greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of quotients.
comment: Column 1 is essentially A007952. - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 27 2008
formula: The triangular subarray of A140060 consisting of rows whose terms are distinct. If n is the first term in a row (i.e., if n is a term of A082447), then Q(n,1)=n, Q(n,k)=k*Floor(Q(n,k-1)/k).
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 03 2008
